Name: ConvertFrom-SddlString
Synopsis: Converts a SDDL string to a custom object.

Name: Format-Hex
Synopsis: Displays a file or other input as hexadecimal.

Name: Get-FileHash
Synopsis: Computes the hash value for a file by using a specified hash algorithm.

Name: Import-PowerShellDataFile
Synopsis: Imports values from a `.PSD1` file without invoking its contents.

Name: New-Guid
Synopsis: Creates a GUID.

Name: New-TemporaryFile
Synopsis: Creates a temporary file.

Name: Add-Member
Synopsis: Adds custom properties and methods to an instance of a PowerShell object.

Name: Add-Type
Synopsis: Adds a Microsoft .NET class to a PowerShell session.

Name: Clear-Variable
Synopsis: Deletes the value of a variable.

Name: Compare-Object
Synopsis: Compares two sets of objects.

Name: ConvertFrom-Csv
Synopsis: Converts object properties in character-separated value (CSV) format into CSV versions of the original objects.

Name: ConvertFrom-Json
Synopsis: Converts a JSON-formatted string to a custom object.

Name: ConvertFrom-String
Synopsis: Extracts and parses structured properties from string content.

Name: ConvertFrom-StringData
Synopsis: Converts a string containing one or more key and value pairs to a hash table.

Name: Convert-String
Synopsis: Formats a string to match examples.

Name: ConvertTo-Csv
Synopsis: Converts .NET objects into a series of character-separated value (CSV) strings.

Name: ConvertTo-Html
Synopsis: Converts .NET objects into HTML that can be displayed in a Web browser.

Name: ConvertTo-Json
Synopsis: Converts an object to a JSON-formatted string.

Name: ConvertTo-Xml
Synopsis: Creates an XML-based representation of an object.

Name: Debug-Runspace
Synopsis: Starts an interactive debugging session with a runspace.

Name: Disable-PSBreakpoint
Synopsis: Disables the breakpoints in the current console.

Name: Disable-RunspaceDebug
Synopsis: Disables debugging on one or more runspaces, and releases any pending debugger stop.

Name: Enable-PSBreakpoint
Synopsis: Enables the breakpoints in the current console.

Name: Enable-RunspaceDebug
Synopsis: Enables debugging on runspaces where any breakpoint is preserved until a debugger is attached.

Name: Export-Alias
Synopsis: Exports information about currently defined aliases to a file.

Name: Export-Clixml
Synopsis: Creates an XML-based representation of an object or objects and stores it in a file.

Name: Export-Csv
Synopsis: Converts objects into a series of character-separated value (CSV) strings and saves the strings to a file.

Name: Export-FormatData
Synopsis: Saves formatting data from the current session in a formatting file.

Name: Export-PSSession
Synopsis: Exports commands from another session and saves them in a PowerShell module.

Name: Format-Custom
Synopsis: Uses a customized view to format the output.

Name: Format-List
Synopsis: Formats the output as a list of properties in which each property appears on a new line.

Name: Format-Table
Synopsis: Formats the output as a table.

Name: Format-Wide
Synopsis: Formats objects as a wide table that displays only one property of each object.

Name: Get-Alias
Synopsis: Gets the aliases for the current session.

Name: Get-Culture
Synopsis: Gets the current culture set in the operating system.

Name: Get-Date
Synopsis: Gets the current date and time.

Name: Get-Event
Synopsis: Gets the events in the event queue.

Name: Get-EventSubscriber
Synopsis: Gets the event subscribers in the current session.

Name: Get-FormatData
Synopsis: Gets the formatting data in the current session.

Name: Get-Host
Synopsis: Gets an object that represents the current host program.

Name: Get-Member
Synopsis: Gets the properties and methods of objects.

Name: Get-PSBreakpoint
Synopsis: Gets the breakpoints that are set in the current session.

Name: Get-PSCallStack
Synopsis: Displays the current call stack.

Name: Get-Random
Synopsis: Gets a random number, or selects objects randomly from a collection.

Name: Get-Runspace
Synopsis: Gets active runspaces within a PowerShell host process.

Name: Get-RunspaceDebug
Synopsis: Shows runspace debugging options.

Name: Get-TraceSource
Synopsis: Gets PowerShell components that are instrumented for tracing.

Name: Get-TypeData
Synopsis: Gets the extended type data in the current session.

Name: Get-UICulture
Synopsis: Gets the current UI culture settings in the operating system.

Name: Get-Unique
Synopsis: Returns unique items from a sorted list.

Name: Get-Variable
Synopsis: Gets the variables in the current console.

Name: Group-Object
Synopsis: Groups objects that contain the same value for specified properties.

Name: Import-Alias
Synopsis: Imports an alias list from a file.

Name: Import-Clixml
Synopsis: Imports a CLIXML file and creates corresponding objects in PowerShell.

Name: Import-Csv
Synopsis: Creates table-like custom objects from the items in a character-separated value (CSV) file.

Name: Import-LocalizedData
Synopsis: Imports language-specific data into scripts and functions based on the UI culture that's selected for the operating system.

Name: Import-PSSession
Synopsis: Imports commands from another session into the current session.

Name: Invoke-Expression
Synopsis: Runs commands or expressions on the local computer.

Name: Invoke-RestMethod
Synopsis: Sends an HTTP or HTTPS request to a RESTful web service.

Name: Invoke-WebRequest
Synopsis: Gets content from a web page on the internet.

Name: Measure-Command
Synopsis: Measures the time it takes to run script blocks and cmdlets.

Name: Measure-Object
Synopsis: Calculates the numeric properties of objects, and the characters, words, and lines in string objects, such as files of text.

Name: New-Alias
Synopsis: Creates a new alias.

Name: New-Event
Synopsis: Creates a new event.

Name: New-Object
Synopsis: Creates an instance of a Microsoft .NET Framework or COM object.

Name: New-TimeSpan
Synopsis: Creates a TimeSpan object.

Name: New-Variable
Synopsis: Creates a new variable.

Name: Out-File
Synopsis: Sends output to a file.

Name: Out-GridView
Synopsis: Sends output to an interactive table in a separate window.

Name: Out-Printer
Synopsis: Sends output to a printer.

Name: Out-String
Synopsis: Outputs input objects as a string.

Name: Read-Host
Synopsis: Reads a line of input from the console.

Name: Register-EngineEvent
Synopsis: Subscribes to events that are generated by the PowerShell engine and by the `New-Event` cmdlet.

Name: Register-ObjectEvent
Synopsis: Subscribes to the events that are generated by a Microsoft .NET Framework object.

Name: Remove-Event
Synopsis: Deletes events from the event queue.

Name: Remove-PSBreakpoint
Synopsis: Deletes breakpoints from the current console.

Name: Remove-TypeData
Synopsis: Deletes extended types from the current session.

Name: Remove-Variable
Synopsis: Deletes a variable and its value.

Name: Select-Object
Synopsis: Selects objects or object properties.

Name: Select-String
Synopsis: Finds text in strings and files.

Name: Select-Xml
Synopsis: Finds text in an XML string or document.

Name: Send-MailMessage
Synopsis: Sends an email message.

Name: Set-Alias
Synopsis: Creates or changes an alias for a cmdlet or other command in the current PowerShell session.

Name: Set-Date
Synopsis: Changes the system time on the computer to a time that you specify.

Name: Set-PSBreakpoint
Synopsis: Sets a breakpoint on a line, command, or variable.

Name: Set-TraceSource
Synopsis: Configures, starts, and stops a trace of PowerShell components.

Name: Set-Variable
Synopsis: Sets the value of a variable. Creates the variable if one with the requested name does not exist.

Name: Show-Command
Synopsis: Displays PowerShell command information in a graphical window.

Name: Sort-Object
Synopsis: Sorts objects by property values.

Name: Start-Sleep
Synopsis: Suspends the activity in a script or session for the specified period of time.

Name: Tee-Object
Synopsis: Saves command output in a file or variable and also sends it down the pipeline.

Name: Trace-Command
Synopsis: Configures and starts a trace of the specified expression or command.

Name: Unblock-File
Synopsis: Unblocks files that were downloaded from the internet.

Name: Unregister-Event
Synopsis: Cancels an event subscription.

Name: Update-FormatData
Synopsis: Updates the formatting data in the current session.

Name: Update-List
Synopsis: Adds items to and removes items from a property value that contains a collection of objects.

Name: Update-TypeData
Synopsis: Updates the extended type data in the session.

Name: Wait-Debugger
Synopsis: Stops a script in the debugger before running the next statement in the script.

Name: Wait-Event
Synopsis: Waits until a particular event is raised before continuing to run.

Name: Write-Debug
Synopsis: Writes a debug message to the console.

Name: Write-Error
Synopsis: Writes an object to the error stream.

Name: Write-Host
Synopsis: Writes customized output to a host.

Name: Write-Information
Synopsis: Specifies how PowerShell handles information stream data for a command.

Name: Write-Output
Synopsis: Writes the specified objects to the pipeline.

Name: Write-Progress
Synopsis: Displays a progress bar within a PowerShell command window.

Name: Write-Verbose
Synopsis: Writes text to the verbose message stream.

Name: Write-Warning
Synopsis: Writes a warning message.
